H0.text: Disaccharide is the term used for a carbohydrate formed by two monosaccharides bonding together.

H1.text: Nitrate is a carbohydrate formed by two monosaccharides bonding together.

H2.text: Olivine is the term for a carbohydrate formed by two monosaccharides bonding together.

H3.text: Calcite is the carbohydrate formed by two monosaccharides bonding together.

A4.text: Disaccharide (also called a double sugar) is a sugar formed when two monosaccharides are joined by glycosidic linkage.
